description: From Russian зе́мство (zémstvo), from земля́ (zemljá, “land, country”).

entries.meaning: (now historical) A Russian district or provincial council, or elective local-governmental administrative division, founded in 1864 by Tsar Alexander the Liberator.
examples: Two of Alexander III's counter-reforms, in 1890 and 1892, greatly increased the governors' powers over the zemstvos and municipal bodies.
